alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:03PM EST until January 12 at 4:44AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 20.9 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 02/25/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
